page.title: 07Interviews with Local People
page.content:
{A LADY RESIDENT OF CROPTHORNE.
"60 years ago as a girl, living on the farm next to the school, I would help to load the produce, cabbage etc. on to the horse and dray and take it to the railway sidings at Charlton. There were no lorries going through the village and I could bowl my hoop from one end of the village street to the other. In Summer, we would spin our tops all the way up the street." { {A GRANDAD WHO FARMS LOCALLY TOLD US
"I have lived here 61 years. Horses were used to pull the plough and help with the work on the farm. When I left school all the boys, in my class, except two, went to work on the land.
